intro: Syzygium maire, commonly known as kahikatea, is a flowering plant species native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy white flowers. The plant typically grows as a tall tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 20 meters. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Syzygium maire plays an important ecological role in New Zealand's native forests.
